Anyway, we will not bother looking for another place to stay: The unposh, very latin and supercentral location is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Good, saft and comfortable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: davidjun
Reviews.Content: We had stayed in this hotel for one night before our cruise in March, 2011. Staff is courteous and helpful. The location is great. The price is fair. The remodeled room is clean, comfortable and modern. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel - central location”
Reviews.Author: 115owner
Reviews.Content: Central hotel , just in one of the side roads of Ramblas and 1 min away from Bouqeira Market. Hotel in very good condition , room clean , bathrooms tatty!!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Anon092
Reviews.Content: Boutique hotel on a side street close to La Rambla. Convenient base for touring the city centre and all points beyond. As you leave the hotel, turn left and it's only a few hundred metres to the buzz of La Rambla ... lots of cafes, bars and shops nearby (although many shops are closed on Sundays!). Hotel is clean and decor is modern. Only slight criticisms are that the rooms are a bit on the small side (as you would perhaps expect in many major cities), the views from the rooms are not that great, there are only a limited number of English-speaking TV channels and the reception staff are pleasant but painfully slow! Only other cautionary note is that if you leave the hotel and turn right, some of the streets further along don't seem to be in the greatest neighbourhood! But turn left, head for La Rambla and you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location - shame about the staff”
Reviews.Author: Spanner82
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 2 nights here to enjoy beautiful Barcelona. The location of the hotel is great, just of La Rambla and 2 minutes to a metro station. While it can be a noisy area, the rooms were very well insulated against noise. Value is average for a hotel of this standard. The rooms are average size, modern and clean, however my only complaint is that there was no air conditioning. We were told that there is no air con during "winter" however with temperatures in the mid-20s celcius, the rooms got very hot at night. Having the window open provided very little relief, and allowed the street noise in, so best avoid this hotel if you would like to sleep. The staff were also quite rude. One argued with me about the definition of twin and double beds when I was provided with the wrong type, even though my booking clearly stated the requested type. Overall, I would recommend this as it's a modern and clean hotel in a good location. However, be wary of the lack of air conditioning if you're not going in summer.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: IGJ44
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location and is clean, however what isn't clear before you book is that it is very noisy. The rooms were warm almost too warm to sleep and you couldn't open the windows because the noise from the neighbours was also too much to allow sleep. One of the neighbours dead opposite our 5th floor room decided to have a party at 11.30pm that went on to 1.30am, you couldn't hear yourself think with the window closed! If you want to be in the heart of the city and don't mind the noise this hotel is fine but if you need something more quiet and less humid then find somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: felicityjg
Reviews.Content: Situated a minute's walk from the middle of La Rambla and a further minute to the Metro Station. The Hotel is spotless! This break was a rebook from one cancelled by the snow in December. Despite having made a non-refundable booking, as soon as we were forced to cancel the Front Desk Manager offered to rebook for another time. We paid a very reasonable amount more for the booking a week before Easter (instead of totally out of season!). We arrived by 10am and had our rooms been ready we would have been able to check straight in. As it was, the desk looked after our luggage and we were free to go out. The rooms are small but totally adequate with lots of wardrobe and shelf space. They are modern and spotless. Ours looked over a back alley - but it was a city break - and provided the room is quiet and comfortable I don't care about a view! The bathroom was a good size and had a hot, powerful walk in shower. (Do make sure the door is fully closed - there is a good seal around it, but it does need to make contact!). There was a safe in the wardrobe. The breakfast can be pre-booked to save a few euro and was excellent. The bread was delicious and fresh, as was the fruit. The coffee machine, however, did take an age to make coffee, and the kettle took a long time to boil! The only very small complaint was that there was only one girl doing absolutely everything. She coped admirably, but at the weekend it would have been more efficient to have 2 people on duty. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would certainly stay there again should we return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: kinhell
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from teh hesperia Ramblas. It's conveniently located and couldnlt be in a better position with teh Ramblas 50 yards away along with Liceu Metro station. The hotel is new and clean with a modern decor. The front desk were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “What's all the hysteria about hesperia? : convenient location, average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Coffeeprincess
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend break here. Not as enamoured by this hotel as many of the previous reviewers though it was certainly decent. Hotel is located on a side street a few hundred yards from the hustle and bustle of La Ramblas, however if you head a few hundred yards in the opposite direction you will find a very rundown part of the city. However it is close to LIceu metro station and therefore is a convenient base for exploring this beautiful city. Room was nicely decorated and pleasant enough but it was rather on the small side, so much so that if you sat at the solitary table in the room your partner cant get to the other side of the room without clamouring over the bed. On the positive side the room was very clean, though the bathroom was basic including a large shower area which tended to flood the rest of the bathroom when in use. Breakfast was also okay with a selection of cooked meat, cereals, fruit and pastries, though the self-service coffee maker/hot water maker took an age to fill a cup (no black tea bags either). All that said, these criticisms are relatively minor and easy to fix, and we would certainly not discourage anyone from staying here. If you do make sure you visit Park Guell, an amazing hillside park designed by the maestro Gaudi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravellingLou
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at this hotel because of the location and great reviews. The location was perfect for us, just off of La Ramblas and very close to Liceu Station. The hotel was spotlessly clean, room was a great size and very nicely decorated. The beds were so comfortable and there was not a sound from outside once the windows were shut. We also really enjoyed the breakfasts. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend others to stay here too.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aany
Reviews.Content: Modern and spotlessly clean, a little gem of a hotel. Really good location, only 1 minute away from Liceu metro stop and La Ramblas. Very quiet, as soon as you close the window you are in your own little paradise. Modern and comfortable rooms, lovely bathroom and shower. Free WiFi was a big plus :). I would definetly stay here again if returning to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in La Rambla Area”
Reviews.Author: mr_cruiser
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3-nights pre-cruise in February. Great location on side-street just a couple short blocks away from La Rambla, Liceu Metro and Boqueria Market, so it was very convenient and close to all the action yet very quiet at night. Super central location meant it was an easy walk from Catalunya Place where the Airport bus drops you off, and an easy walk to the Columbus monument at the foot of Rambla where we took the Shuttle bus to the Cruise ship terminal. From the hotel you can explore La Rambla, the old town, Barri Gothic, El Raval, etc. by foot. To see more of Barcelona (Montjuic, Parc Guell, Sagrada Familia, Torre Agbar, Olympic Waterfront, etc) we took the excellent value hop-on hop-off bus (we choose the RED HOHO as it goes to goes to more sights and areas than the other Green one). The hotel itself is newish and more modern than others we considered, the 4th floor was quiet and our room was clean and adequate size but sparsely furnished, good water pressure, nice double-glazed window overlooking the street (Le Hospital), the safe was large enough to hold a notebook and other important stuff, free wireless is included (there is computer access with a printer in the lobby if you don't have your computer but you have to pay for this service). We didn't have breakfast in the hotel as there were lots of nice eateries to experience nearby. We felt very safe even coming back late at night as the hotel was very close to Rambla, plus you have to ring the bell to get entry (many hotels there have this security feature). Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: houstonflygirl33
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights and it was mire than expected. All the reviews are good and proved to be true. La boqueria was a treat. We bought fruit, fresh bread, ham, cheese and kept in the fridge in the room. Also bought wine from a great shop 2 side streets past hotel in the corner of the boqueria. This saved us money and it was just delicious. There is a bakery next to the hotel on the same side of the street. We ate here everyday! Great quiches, delicious empanadas, everything they sell us amazing!! We took food with us on the bus tour :) I highly recommend this hotel. Worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal (overall), Great Aesthetic & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TransEuropaExpress
Reviews.Content: Overall, this hotel is a great deal in a great location- if you prefer to stay right off the Ramblas near the Gothic Quarter which we did. The hotel is relatively new (built probably within the last 5 years), and has a great modern aesthetic (think West Elm meets Ikea), but unfortunately it seems like they ran out of money when it came to the lighting and bathroom fixtures- most of them seemed like they would (or in some cases did) fall apart as soon as you touched them, or they were poorly mounted and it showed- which is a shame, since otherwise, the interior design was quite nice and modern. The toiletry handouts were also kind of cheap, so bring your one and don't expect any l'occitane toiletries or anything of the sort. Free Wifi is a plus as long as you're stationary, and the in-room safe is also appreciated. We opted out of the buffet breakfast, and decided rather to explore the local options of which there are plenty. Otherwise, the staff was very kind and helpful and mostly on the ball. We had an issue with the toilet running, and someone was sent up to fix it immediately. Would definitely recommend to someone else.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at this clean and modern hotel with polite and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: J0b_27
Reviews.Content: stayed for 4 nights, arrived at hotel approx 10.30pm, able to access coffee and pastries on arrival. cleanliness evident immediatly in reception area. lift access to rooms based over 5 floors. booked breakfast for the next morning so a small 2 euro discount was applied. Breakfast - juices, pastries, cereal, toast, bacon, scrambled egg, sausage, fruit also available plus tea and coffee, self service. Rooms very clean and modern, great shower/bath, daily maid service. safe available in room at no extra charge, also a mini bar available in room. no tea or coffe making facilities in room, however plugs available for if a travel kettle was taken. 1 minute walk to main street Ramblas, easy to access metro train and walk to tourist bus services. The fantastic Boqueria market is accessed approx 50 yards from hotel. no excessive noise was heard from the hotel and overall the hotel was quiet. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good central hotel at a cheap price”
Reviews.Author: darraghke
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 27th Feb until 3rd March 2011. Located just off the Ramblas, a great place to base yourself for getting around Barcelona. The hotel is nice. You must ring the bell to gain access to the hotel, a bit strange but at least it shows they are security conscious. The rooms are of good standard. Just a couple of small points, the bed was far too low, I never slept in a bed so low it felt like I was sleeping on the floor. And no extractor fan in the bathroom.After a shower the bathroom tended to be very hot and humid for ages afterwards. If I am coming back to Barcelona I will look up this hotel first

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: luvninou
Reviews.Content: Just came back from my barcelona trip where i spent 3 nights at the Hesperia Hotel. The location of the hotel is perfect; in a small street by Las Ramblas (the place to stay in in barcelona). The staff is so nice, courteous, and helpful. The rooms are quite spacious fro european standards. The design is ultra chic & modern, all made with white & grey shades. The beds are comfy & the bathroom is very modern. The hotel & rooms are kept clean daily. It's a lit bit noisy as it is right on the city center, but you can still sleep fine at night. We checked other hotels in the area, & all had the same problems, at least Hesperia is located in a small street, so the noise isn't unbearable We never felt unsafe while walking to the hotel at night, although we found many prostitues on the main avenue in Las Ramblas, but really, nothing to brag about. Getting around : - You can take the hop on hop off busses (bus turistica is by far the best) to see the main sightseeing, don't forget to ask for the headsets once inside. We tried it on friday, which was a good option but i'm glad we didn't get it on saturday & sunday as there were HUGE lines to get into the bus. If you are interested ask in the front desk for the tickets coz you get a 2 euros/person discount & they give you a small booklet that has tons of discounts. Otherwise the taxi is a very good option as i found that it was't expensive at all (25 euros to the airport for the four of us). Food : - We had breakfast at the hotel, almost 11 euros (2 euros discount if you tell them as soon as you come). Ok it's a little bit expensive, but it's worth it; good selection of pasteries, fresh juices, coffee, cheeses, scrambled eggs, breads, sausages, fresh fruits, cereals & yogurts. Otherwise, there's a starbucks coffee 5 to 10 min walk from hotel. - We found the food in barcelona very delicious, we tried many tapas restaurants; i think the best one is called Txapela (located in passeo Gracia right after plaza Catalunya, you pass across the huge "El Corte Engles" & it's 3 min away on your right), there was also a good one (u shouldn't be on a hurry though & i woudn't recommand their paella) named "Taller de Tapas" & located on the small streets in front of the hotel in Place Sant Josep Oriol, N°9 (Pl. del Pi) - On my birthday we tried "Con Gracia" Restaurant, you have to make online reservation at least couple weeks before on tehir website. It is expensive (around 60 euros/per + beverages), but in my opinion it's one of the best. It's not a hispanic restaurant, but a great mixture between japaneese & mediterranean food. They have only 2 menus, one they call traditional & the other one "surprise", made up only for you based on what you like & dislike but you can only pick up one menu per table. We tried the traditional one & it was a great experience, we also saw some people getting the surprise menu & it was as delicious. There were some combination of food i've never tried & the mixture of ingredients was devine. For sure, i'll go back there if i ever visit barcelona. SIGHTSEEING : We didn't have time to see it all, but we picked up the following & it was a rewarding experience : - Nou Camp (Stadium) : for the FCBarcelona fans, yes i'd recommand ot, otherwise just skip this tour - Casa Batllo : Very charming & beautifully made with all the details Gaudi thought about. I highly recommand it - La Segrada Familia (Church Sacred Family) : Beautiful structure. Unfortunately we couldn't get inside on the 2 days we went there (we went quite early on the 2nd day). there was always a 3hrs waiting line & we just couldn't take it. Maybe we'll be lucky enough to visit it next time - Guell Park : When the bus drops you, you will have to walk on a VERY STEEP street for 5-10min. It's a wonderful place on a sunny day. You can enjoy a nice view from teh top of the gardens, & there r musicians all around the park - We loved walking around & discovering the city especially on the narrow streets just past Las Ramblas area, we'd get lost & then found out our way. Totally safe & fun visit. You get a different taste of the city. On sunday you can find farmers selling their products (cheese, flan, olives, homemade biscuits..etc).

Reviews.Title: “would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Lifesdepth
Reviews.Content: In January for 3 nights prior to our cruise we choise Hesperia Ramblas. It was excellent price and great location! Our first time in Barcelona and we could not have chosen a better place! Our room was clean, bright and specious. Not much to add to other positive comments. The staff was friendly and helpful. Nicely decorated and comfortable pleasant lobby. We were out most of the time and it was pleasure to get back to good "home" away from home.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of all the fun. Great Hotel. Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Nym18
Reviews.Content: The hotel was spotless, the service staff were very helpful. The front desk manager was really patient with us coz we were first time travellers in BCN. It's in the middle of everything, location wise. Very pleased. will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Super value and location”
Reviews.Author: Portcruiser
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January, 2011 for a four day sightseeing visit. You can book on their own site for the best rates with no penalty if you need to cancel. http://www.hesperia.com/ I cannot say many more good things that what others have already written. You can't beat the location of this hotel if you want to stay in the Las Ramblas area.. Next to the Boqueria Market for fresh cut fruit and pastries at bargain prices [if you wlak to the right and turn right there's even a shortcut], a Dunkin Donuts a block up Las Ramblas for American coffee if you want, and right by the Liceu metro stop or a short walk to the hop-on-hop-off buses for which the hotel provides a nice discount -- buy a 2 day pass since you want the red line one day and the blue another. Clean and modern and new. On Google maps the picture has it still under construction. The staff was friendly and helpful and speak English well. Free internet is available in your room [they give you a password good for your entire stay] or computers in the lobby for guests. The safe in the room is large enough for your laptop and lots of other stuff. Bring a converter for Europe and a washcloth which hotels here do not offer. The towels are large and fluffy. The rooms are quiet. The beds are nice and firm. Want great food then for Tapas cross Las Ramblas and find Irati at Cardinal Casanyes 17; for dinners La Fonda or Pelai a 10 minute walk in different directions [the hotel will print you Google maps for them] or Osmosis, the #2 rated, -- a cab ride. Do not miss the Roman ruins in the basement of the city museum in the Barrio Gotico just a 15 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: rupi22
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice and very comfortable and the shower works very nicely. It is not expensive for Barcelona and it is very quite to sleep at night. Breakfast very nice and I am very happy with this hotel and next time I will stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: car6
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and loved it. The staff was wonderful, the room was clean and the location cannot be beat. It is one block from La Rambla and the Liceu Metro Stop. It is in the immediate vicinity of La Boqueria (right next door!) and a short walk from the Gothic Neighborhood. It is walkable to the beach, Sagrada Familia and other sites (albeit, these are fairly long walks). One thing to note - we couldn't control the room temperature very well and it was very hot.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: aussiewineguy
Reviews.Content: Our second time in Barcelona was somewhat brief. We were overnight readying to board our cruise ship the following day. The hotel is just off La Rambla in an easily accessible location - right in the heart of 'downtown' not too far from Catalunya, it is also easy walking distance from one of the metro stops. The hotel is in excellent condition, and we were able to check in early. The breakfast the next day was buffet style and actually a decent selection (loved the fresh fruit), and the price wasn't too bad (10 euros pp). Very convenient if you don't have time for a late-ish breakfast elsewhere. Room was in great condition, nice big bathroom and comfortable bed. Internet included was great, allowed us to organize a few things, and review online maps etc. Staff were prompt and courteous, and gave good directions to a major department store where we were able to buy multi plug adapters. All in all, precisely what we were aiming for, and it didn't break the bank. Great location for exploring Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: cheznelson
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on a prepay deal and got a great price, including breakfast. Very impressed with the room (especially the powerful walk in shower!), decor, location, and breakfast choice. Good minibar prices too. In room safe to lock away your valuables, a/c or heating as the season dictates and free wifi connection. We had a room overlooking Carrer Hospital, which was a little noisy at night if you left the windows open, but then you are in the heart of the city, so should espect this. Metro stop at the end of the street and very easy access by airport bus from the airport. All major sites within walking distance (and walking is the best way to see this city). Public transport costs very good value.

Reviews.Title: “excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Evie09London
Reviews.Content: Very clean, nice breakfast, very quiet and good value. Very impressed!! And most important close to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, clean and friendly and so near to everything.”
Reviews.Author: shoprojb
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in early Oct. 2010. While the room was small it was spotless clean and very quiet. The hotel is a fairly new building located just a block off the Ramblas and just around the corner from the central market. There are a lot of resturants nearby and the Metro station is a very short walk. The Hesperia Ramblas was ideal place to stay. The staff was great, friendly, spoke english fluently and were always there to answer any questions and provide directions. I speak and understand a little Spanish so I was able to communicate very well. I would definately return there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ecd200
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location of this hotel. Next to the Boqueria Market and right by the metro. Clean and modern...this is a great find. The staff was friendly and helpful. Free internet is available in your room or computers in the lobby for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend undoubtedly! :)”
Reviews.Author: Prima_ee
Reviews.Content: Was staying at Hesperia Ramblas July 2008. Staff was very welcoming and helping if you need wonder what to see round -- gave maps, ads etc and do speak sufficient English. Hotel isn't crowded itself and surprisingly quiet even if windows look at the road. Rooms are comfortable, nothing less, nothing more, all is at high standard: very clean and neat. No complains to the typical light continental breakfast. And most important: very good location - beginning of La Rambla is in a 1-min walking distance, + bus and metro stops!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: mebanana
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty new and the decor reflects this - very modern. It is clean, well serviced but not luxurious - the rooms are pretty small and the desk staff are helpful but not pandering. However, if you come here, you don't pay for luxury! The location couldn't be better - many of the sights are a short walk away and the rest are accessible by the nearby metro station. We had a great time here and I'd thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel in a central location - everthing you need for a stay in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: EnglandRatbag
Reviews.Content: Well appointed room albeit a little small. Super bathroom supplied with all you might need (down to toothbrush, toothpaste and sponge. Las Ramblas and Metro about 50m away. Clean, friendly and amenable - a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel - worth its price !”
Reviews.Author: marianmachi
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel in the heart of Barcelona. We have enjoyed our stay here, though we have stayed only few nights here, we felt we were warmly welcome by the front desk stuff, always willing to help. But i must confess, we had no non-standard requests on them, since everything was going smoothly :) The rooms were very clean and despite the fact you're in the city center (small side street) you don't hear any noise neither from the street, nor from other rooms. The rooms are not very spacious, but for the short stay in Barcelona its worth its price. Its located just a few steps from La Rambla so both shops, cultural sight and nighlife activities are reachable in walking distance. We didn't even buy any public transport ticket (didn't need to due to good location of hotel). I didn't have the chance to taste the Breakfast buffet here, since the Mercat La Boqueria is just few meters away, you can walk there anytime and buy fresh breakfast. Our group was 100% satisfied with this hotel, and YES we will recommend to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel, tiny rooms, good location.”
Reviews.Author: alsobidingmytime
Reviews.Content: Check-in was efficient and reception was friendly. Surprised by the size of the room -- it was tiny. There was very little room to move around the queen sized bed. We had two large suitcases that took up quite a bit of room on the window-side of the bed. The size of the bathroom was adequate. The room was clean but the shower door did not close completely because there was a bit of mold build-up that prevented the door from fully closing which then allowed water to leak onto the floor. We didn't notify reception as we were only going to be there for a few days and it wasn't a priority. The location of the hotel is good -- right off Las Ramblas. Far enough away to be fairly quiet but close enough for the convenience. Another plus is the proximity of the mercado -- just a quick walk up the narrow street behind the hotel. We enjoyed browsing the mercado each day and had a hot breakfast there one morning. Overall, the stay was fine but if you are looking for luxury this is not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean, modern hotel, just right for us.”
Reviews.Author: johnandpat59
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights with friends. We all agreed the hotel staff were extremely helpful and friendly, advising on trips, travelling around the city, getting taxis, nothing was too much trouble. Breakfast deals were offered and well worth taking. A good selection of hot and cold food was very good and it was all buffet self service, perfect for us. Rooms were spotlessly clean and cleaned every day with fresh towelsdaily and bedding twice during a 4 night stay. We recommend this hotel to people wanting to be quickly in the centre of town, it is on a side street off La Rambla, easy to walk to Placa Catalunya for Tourist buses and Airport transfers. We will stay there again, thank you Hesperia Ramblas!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: lovelyrita_mm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very comfortable and clean. It's conveniently located right off the main drag of La Rambla - and a very short walk to the Liceu Metro stop. The beds are comfortable and I slept really well. We had friends that stayed in a different hotel and they had noise from a disco. That's not the case here - we didn't get any outside noise. The staff was friendly and helpful too. That said - the bathroom sort of has a door - it's a piece of thin plastic that slides sort of over the door, but it may not give you the privacy you might prefer. We would have liked a a real door. Also, the shower only has a curtain dividing it from the rest of the bathroom, so water can spray over the floor. The water pressure, on the other hand, was nice. The rooms have free wifi, which is very nice, but you have to constantly log in. Every time my phone or ipad screenlock went on, I'd have to reenter the wifi username and password, which was a pain. But hey, free wifi! These little things weren't enough to really bother me as the hotel was so quiet and comfortable. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Accommodation, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jonesy21
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October 2010 during a very short visit to Barcelona for which we wanted to be reasonably central. Hesperia Ramblas is just 50m from Rambla de Sant Josep and a short stroll to many bars and restaurants in the vacinity. Rooms were very clean and comfortable, reception staff very helpful. Beware of the theives/pickpockets in Barcelona, we weren't targeted ourselvesbut witnessed two bag snatchings in the two days we were there.

Reviews.Title: “A glitch in their system”
Reviews.Author: GoddessKris
Reviews.Content: As you will read below, my rating is not based on the hotel room, its cleanliness, sleep quality, etc. because even though we had booked to stay at this hotel, we were pretty much rejected as soon as we entered the hotel property. After a long and uncomfortable flight on an old aircraft from America, we finally arrived in Barcelona, ready to take a shower, unwind, and get our vacation started. However, when we arrived at the hotel, the staff told us that a problem in their system had us booked NOT at the Hesperia Ramblas, but another Hesperias property on their other side of Las Ramblas. After not being able to convince them to let us just stay at the hotel since the fault was theirs, we waited in the lobby for a taxi to come get us to take us to the other hotel. When the taxi finally came, we had to sit through the hotel staff and the taxi driver haggling over price. We didn't understand what was going on, until we started driving. What would have been a very short walk, the taxi ride was over 10 minutes through the back streets of El Raval. And the best part is, the taxi couldn't even drop us off at the hotel. We got dropped off on Las Ramblas, and with the taxi driver telling us it's only a 2 minute walk to the hotel, we proceeded to get lost in the small streets of Barrio Gotic. Luckily, we found a helpful local who guided us to the hotel. Needless to say, I was disappointed by this entire ordeal, especially because a friend of mind had recommended the Hesperias Ramblas to us. I was disappointed at the lack of professionalism and the low quality of customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, just OK hotel, free wifi, good value, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: GreenwichNick
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel has to be one of the best in Barcelona - just off La Rambla, a couple of minutes' walk from Liceu metro. All the Barri Gotíc is in walking distance, and also on the Poble Sec side of La Rambla there are plenty of bars and restos in walking distance. Metro line L3 takes you plenty of places, or you can walk up La Rambla to Catalunya. I was a bit disappointed with hotel - while it's modern and clean, it feels a bit grubby and cramped, and too many things didn't quite work first time - I couldn't get the wired Intert access to work, although the free wifi was just fine; my phone didn't work and I had to ask for it to be replaced. The room was small and bare. All that said, this hotel was good value, the staff were friendly and helpful, and I *would* stay here again. It's a great lowish budget option for staying in the centre of town for those of us who want something better than the low end.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Worldsbig
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel after reading positive reviews on Tripadvisor. We were pleasantly surprised with the Hesperia Ramblas. The convenience of this hotel is paramount. It is just off of Las Ramblas, with the subway and bus stations close by. The rooms are simple with a modern approach. They appear very clean and we felt very comfortable in the room. Beds were rather firm, as this appears to be common throughout all of Europe. No outside noise was heard either! We didn't eat at their restaurant, as the market (Mercat de Boqueria) was a two minute walk away. For 130 euros, we felt this was a good deal. No internet, without extra charges, or fitness center. Still happy with Hesperia Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in the heart of town.”
Reviews.Author: DG78
Reviews.Content: Perfectly clean, tidy, comfortable and quiet. Excellent base to investigate this amazing city. Turn left out of the hotel and you are a few meters from La Ramblas and then a hop, skip and a jump away from everywhere else you may want to visit. Turn right out of the hotel and you are in the Raval district, great if you love nooks and crannies, bars and boutiques, the rough and the smooth. Behind the hotel is the wonderful Boqueria Market...torturous if you love fresh ingredients as you have nowhere to cook them...but fun all the same. One complaint. The male receptionist who was manning the desk as we arrived for our one and only holiday of the year which we had scraped and saved for, failed to look up from his computer as we stood in front of him for at least a minute. Not long you might think. But not a polite greeting in anyones book. He them proceeded to book us in without a welcome, or a smile, or very much else for that matter. Thankfully he only seemed to work mornings. The woman who worked afternoons and evenings was delightful, helpful, friendly and welcoming and made up for the rude "welcome". Unfortunately-he also checked us out, and his attitude was equally sullen then also. I will try not to take it personally.

Reviews.Title: “Right off Las Ramblas and Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: TheDarsts
Reviews.Content: We walked right past the very un-assuming entrance the first time. It's kind of tucked away depending on the direction you're coming from. Within a block of Las Ramblas, the location is perfect, especially at this price. FYI for travelers, there is a Metro stop on Las Ramblas very nearby, it's the Liceu stop in case you're interested. The room was very clean, almost sterile it seemed. Very white and crisp. Room size was very comfortable for the 2 of us. The free wifi was very convenient and we enjoyed our stay very much!

Reviews.Title: “Great mid-range hotel”
Reviews.Author: yrjs2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights in September 2010. Everything was very new and clean. For the price range, the rooms were spacious and they were very tastefully decorated. The bathrooms were equally clean, well equipped and spacious with a good large shower. It was a great location, just off the Rambla and within walking distance of most of the major sites. My only minor quibble would be with the receptionist, who kept getting distracted while checking us in and dealing with other things. As breakfast was not included in the price of the room, I am not able to review that.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location, very helpful staff. A real gem!.”
Reviews.Author: MerciBeaucoup
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last December. We were surprised how great the hotel was considering the price and the central location. it was very quiet despite being just off Las Ramblas. The staff were very helpful, the hotel itself is modern, very comfortable and very clean. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will return this year.

Reviews.Title: “Handy to everything”
Reviews.Author: Ragdad
Reviews.Content: Good service and very close to the market, Ramblas and Metro. Friendly and helpful staff with good English. Great breakfast selection, but avoid milk coffee from machine as made from sweet milk powder.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute gem. Recommended to any City Breakers”
Reviews.Author: Best_Gillybear
Reviews.Content: I booked this for us and our friends after reading a few reviews. Not only was the hotel exceptionally good value for money (best rate was actually booking direct with the hotel and obtaining an extra 15% discount through them), but this is one of the best city centre hotels I've stayed in for a long while. Admittedly the rooms aren't huge, but they are perfectly acceptable. Some have wet rooms and some bathrooms. The complimentary set in the bathroom was very good and included things like travel tissues, anti-perspirant, nail file, etc etc. Free safes and fridge in the room were very welcome. The hotel is quiet, totally secure, very well air conditioned, staff very helpful (a city map is given to you on arrival) and does a good breakfast for around £8 all in. Will definitely come again.

Reviews.Title: “amazing location,perfect and very helpful staffs,clean,safety,more secure”
Reviews.Author: genetix
Reviews.Content: I stayed fro 31th of july to 4th of august at Hesperia Ramblas,Barcelona.The hotel location is heart of La ramblas.It is very close to Placa de Catalunya,picasso museum, sea,shopping centers I mean everywhere.We stayed at room,404.the room is amazing,very clean,staffs are very helpfull,clean,more secure from lots of places.I definetly suggest this hotel to stay.The important point we have booked this hotel on february.The cost is very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Modern, Great Staff and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: aoc613
Reviews.Content: Coming from a fair hotel in Madrid to Barcelona we were very surprised by this great little hotel. It has a great location right off the main street Las Ramblas, but still quiet in the room. Yes the room was definitely small, but it was modern, the bathroom was a good size and the bed was very comfortable. The front desk staff were friendly. The free WiFi was awesome! We didn't get the breakfast option so can't comment on the food. But I would definitely recommend this hotel and it has a great price as well!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay nearby to all locations”
Reviews.Author: oobodoo
Reviews.Content: Very clean and stylish hotel in a sidearm of the vivid Las Ramblas, Barcelona's esplanade. New rooms with nice design and new bathroom. Everything looked nice and new. The room was small but this is usual for Spain. We had a large dresser we could put our clothes as there was not enough space to place the suitcases in the room. There is also a safe big enough to store and charge your notebook as there was a power plug inside. Free wireless and very important: quiet rooms! We have ordered a quiet room and got one to a back alley. Close by to all the sightseeing spots in the old town district and to the subway station. There is breakfast available but we haven't used it as there is plenty of patiseries around to start with a coffee and some sweet pastries into the morning. Service was ok and friendly. We were able to check-in at 11 AM. I would highly recommend to stay there as everything was better than expected and required.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra modern and supremely clean hotel in fantastic location!!!”
Reviews.Author: koggyboy
Reviews.Content: Had read the glowing reviews on this hotel and was not disappointed when we arrived. Just off la Ramblas down Hospital St, the exterior is glass and cream stone with a really modern look. Good security, you have to press buzzer to let you in (security man in background at night). When you walk in, it's so quiet and peaceful, long reception desk and easy check in, staff were polite. Good lifts that arrived quickly at all times of day and night. Rooms are ultra modern again and so clean, the whole hotel is almost sterile, I've never stayed in anywhere so pristine. The rooms are ultra modern again, with a massive bed and crisp white linen. The decor and curtains are lovely and modern, the floor is a grey resin sort of floor that matches the modern decor, so don't be expecting a plush carpet! There is a double sliding wardrobe and shelving that contains an easy to use free safe and also a good sized fridge that contains the mini bar at very reasonable prices, but if you're stingy like us, you can put your own stuff in there. There are two white bedside tables and a matching larger one opposite with a big mirror above. There is a flat screen TV on the wall. The bathroom is excellent with quality white modern fittings set in a cream stone, a good sized mirror and excellent lighting. There are some nice touches like an extendable mirror, hairdryer and lots of toiletries and bits and pieces like nail file and shoe shine, in fact I've had lesser things in some four star hotels I've stayed in. Lots of white towels. There isn't a bath but the shower makes up for it, it's so big you could could fit three people in it and easily the best shower I've ever come across. Fab air con as well. The whole place has a tranquil vibe about it and considering it's location, we didn't hear anything and slept like babies all the time we were there. Will be the only place we'll stay now as it's such good value for money and would definitely recommend. If you haven't been to Barcelona before, getting around the place is so easy. Don't get a taxi from the aiport as they can be very costly. Come out of the aiport , go left and walk to the Aerobus stop. It's 5 euros to Plaza Catalunya, the big square at the top of La Ramblas. It announces the stops in different languages so you know exactly where you are. About 30 mins on the bus, get off and walk straight down La Ramblas and Hospital St is on the right, a good walk down. Coming back, go to the square again and get a Terminal 1 or 2 bus and they run approx every ten mins. The open top bus is a great way of seeing the city, it has red, green and blue routes and you just hop on and off as you please. You can spend all day on this if you wanted and it costs 22 euros or 29 for a two day ticket. It's so worth it as there is so much to see and it's a brilliant way of seeing it all. The whole system is so well organised and you hardly wait anytime for the next bus to come along. Shopping is fantastic and so are the many restaurants and bars, all serving quality food. The market off La Ramblas is so colourful and vibrant and you can buy ready prepared fruit and freshly squeezed juices which are great after nights out. At the other end of La Ramblas is the harbour area with a shopping plaza and great seafood and Tapas places overlooking the harbour. A colourful and vibrant, bustling city with great architecture, will be rushing back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: jonnytekno
Reviews.Content: Can't fault this hotel. Excellent value, very clean and well presented and in a great location. It's just off La Rambla, which is a tourist mecca, but is central to everything else. The rooms are very nicely air conditoned, quiet and very dark when the curtains are shut. Free wi-fi is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet hotel near everything.”
Reviews.Author: mooresf
Reviews.Content: Great location right off of Las Ramblas. You forget about the city the second you step into the hotel. Las Ramblas is just steps away. A farmers market is to the rear of the hotel which was a great place to grab breakfast. The rooms were tiny, but clean. The hotel staff was extremely helpful. If you are looking for a quiet clean no frills hotel in the middle of everything, this hotel is perfect for you.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel in Central Location...”
Reviews.Author: McGAussie
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel if you like things modern, minimalist and clean in a central location. One block from Las Ramblas and Mercat de la Boqueria with only a 15 minute stroll to either St Jaume Square, the harbour or Placa de Catalunya (where the 3 Hop On Hop Off bus routes depart from). We heard no traffic noise nor noisy neighbours (inside or outside the hotel). Our room was exactly like the hotel’s photo advertising. Our double bed was the usual 2 singles pushed together but they each had large, firm mattresses with feather pillows and crisp white sheets. The room was well lit and the window opened plus had good sized block-out curtains. The air-conditioning was a little noisy but it certainly cooled the room. A mini-bar and safe were hidden in the wardrobe but no iron or ironing board. The bathroom still looked fresh and new, however, my husband was unable to wet shave in the basin as it was too small with no plug (take your electric shaver). The small hair-dryer had only one setting and was fine for a "quick blow-dry and go” rather than styling. Towels were large but no face washer was supplied. Lovely “emergency” toiletries were provided including a nail file, roll-on deodorant, shoe shine, etc but no toothbrush or toothpaste. And if you don’t like combined liquid shower soap/shampoo then bring your own too. We didn’t partake the hotel’s breakfast, but the subterranean breakfast room looked very nice. PC with internet use was available for a small charge or wifi for free. The staff are multilingual and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to most travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay.”
Reviews.Author: compassnorth
Reviews.Content: As a lover of the Spanish culture and all things spanish, I had always dreamt of visiting Barcelona and this was a great experience for me. The hotel was in a perfect location within the city, with everything very close by and great transport links. The rooms were not big, but in a city centre hotel you do not expect that, and they were very nicely done up and very clean. The reception were really helpful in giving directions and tips on where to eat and I really enjoyed my whole stay and have no complaints. The local tapas were out of this world and Barcelona was every bit as fantastic as I had hoped it would be.

Reviews.Title: “very very good”
Reviews.Author: byrnemx
Reviews.Content: we checked in at 1am, no problem. very clean and very quite considering its right in the middle of town. rooms are very modern and stylish. a great stay. we stayed 4 nights. excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly & helpful staff. would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: chunkyl42
Reviews.Content: We arrived early on Saturday and were provided with a quiet room immediately. Rooms are small but clean and neat, all basic items included, safe, fridge, shampoo, etc. Hotel was just off Las Ramblas down a side street which was relatively safe even at 11pm or so. La Boqueria is directly behind the hotel, less than a 2 minute walk up the alley. Front desk clerks were very helpful and a security guard is posted late at night, access to the hotel is restricted fairly well, so you dont feel like anyone can just walk in. We would definitely give this hotel another chance.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, Secure, Quiet, Friendly, Central and Practical”
Reviews.Author: Sooty016
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in mid May 2010, and for the price we paid, I don't think we would have been able to find anything as clean and functional in quite such an ideal location. The decor of this place is modern and funky and the rooms are simple, clean and functional. Breakfast was OK, although being only a stones throw away from the markets and gothic quarter, we found a number of more 'cost effective options' elsewhere. The staff are friendly and genuinely helpful, and possibly the most important feature of this hotel is its security. Even as we waited for our taxi on the last morning, the staff were constantly keeping an eye out for us and our belongings. However, as everyone else has commented, the location of this hotel is possibly its best feature! Although the little back street it is located on is a little dingy, the hotel basically backs on to the markets and is a one minute walk from Las Ramblas and the Gothic Quarter and is central to the Metro (ride at your own risk!) and public transport. Despite its close proximity to the nightlife, once you decide to settle in for the night, the rooms are completely quiet! On our second night, Barcelona had won their league soccer finals and Las Ramblas was packed with soccer celebrations. Despite finding ourselves on the wrong side of the mall, and having a little difficulty making our way through the crowds, riot police etc and back to the hotel, we were pleasantly surprised to find that once safely inside, we didnt' hear a thing for the rest of the night. We would definately recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a clean, secure and functional hotel in the centre of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Very simple and basic hotel, excelent location but the street it is on was very smelly and dirty”
Reviews.Author: lau950
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be too expensive for the quality it was. Yes it was very quiet and clean but so simple and the room and bathroom very small. Also not located on a very pleasent side street. However if you just want somewhere to sleep after your days out in barcelona and you don't mind paying a little extra then this is a good hotel for you. Also felt very safe here as front doors to hotel only let you in once you ring door bell and front desk see you come in.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and well located - modern and efficient”
Reviews.Author: grumpyguts
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as a stopover before embarking on a cruise ship from the port. The hotel is located ideally for the trendy part of the city and is within walking distance of a whole host of different eating and nightlife attractions. We never felt threatened (three blokes travelling together) as some of the reviewers have commented. The hotel was very clean and efficient, with helpful staff and a great position, as above. There is no restaurant for an eveining meal on site, but when you take into account what is around the hotel, this is hardly a hardship. Breakfast is, however, served in the mornings below reception. I didn't think this was particularly fantastic value, but that is mor a function of a weak pound than the hotel being expensive. I would recommend this hotel as a great place from which to explore the best bits of the town.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Quiet”
Reviews.Author: RobertTheRed
Reviews.Content: Comfortable rooms, a little spare on the furniture (bed, table/desk, one chair). Very quiet, especially less than a block from La Ramblas -- probably because it is new construction with modern windows. Didn't eat the breakfast there -- always got food at the Boqueria market one block due north -- but if you need food early, then the market isn't good since nothing is open until 8-ish. Very close to Liceu metro stop, which is a big plus. Free Wi-Fi (but signal is very weak in the x01 rooms, where you'll need a cable to plug into the wall outlet for Internet). Price was pretty decent for Barcelona, so I'd stay here again under similar circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: travelbug_Boston_09
Reviews.Content: Great location one block off of La Ramblas in Barcelona. Steps away from the market, Gothic quarter and countless restaurants and shops. Rooms have a decidedly modern vibe and are very small but also very clean. Desk staff was friendly but not exceptional. Prices varied among various online booking sites and published rates in the hotel. Doing your homework may get you a better deal. Instead of the buffet breakfast head over to the market for some fresh fruit and pastries. If you are interested in doing the open air bus tour you can save 2 Euros by buying your tickets at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, the location is amazing”
Reviews.Author: Sarit23
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyd our stay in Hesperia. The hotel is designed beautifully and it is shown in every liitle detail and The service was very friendly and helpful. The location is unbelievably good. (The only thing that wasn't perfect was that there weren't really hot water in the shower, only lukewarm).

Reviews.Title: “Bargain - great price for lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mistress_Yorkie
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend to Barcelona for a surprise birthday trip in Jan 2010. As I was funding the trip for both of us I did have to keep an eye on budget, but as it was treat I wasn't quite prepared to slum it too much. This place was an absolute gem - reasonably priced, in a great location, and a really nice hotel too! The staff were great, the lady on reception who looks like Jessica Alba was so sweet and helpful, and the whole place is immaculately clean and surprisingly stylish, it more than exceeded my expectations. Location is great, close to the Ramblas and a Metro stop, but not too noisy. Would happily recommend to friends and other people considering it on tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Bruntysnr
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hesperia Ramblas 25-29 April.The hotel in new and in an excellent location, just of La Rambla. All was spotless. We had a bath with shower over, which was powerful. Our room overlooked the side alley which leads into the Broqueria market but there was no noise. The air-con works a treat and you can have the window (door length) open if you want. The towels were a generous size and were changed every day.The bed was huge and comfortable. The reception staff were fluent English speakers and were very friendly. We bought our 2 day 'tourista' bus information pack there which gives a good discount when you buy the tickets at the bus stop (plus other discount vouchers) We also got our postcard stamps at reception. We did not have breakfast there as we slept so well from walking everywhere, that we got up too late! The Broqueria market does lovely fruit smoothies and doghnuts. Most shops stay open till 9pm. Getting to the hotel was really easy. We caught the Aerobus (E5 each) from the airport. This drops you off at Placa de Catalunya. La Rambla is just off this square and the hotel is a 10 minute walk at the most on the right hand side. Eating and drinking is expensive, especially on La Rambla, so we often went to the Carrefour supermarket for bread/cheese/ham and bottled water. Watch out for pickpockets. I kept my cross shoulder bag firmly in front of me, as did most tourists. All streets and alleys were very well lit. There seemed to be plenty of police and civil guards around. A lovely city to visit. Would go again and use this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ossycat
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Hesperia Ramblas on the 21st April - this was a four day break but due to the 'volcanic ash' we had to stay an extra seven days. The bedrooms are clean and bed linen is changed every day there was a wet room shower in the bathroom not a pokey little shower you get in most hotels. We had the buffet breakfast for 4 days and found this to be excellent value. The hotel is very near La Ramblas and easy access to most amenities. The reception staff are very knowledgeable and gave us great advise on how to get to places via metro and railway and supplying us with maps - travel by metro it is excellent. I would especially like to thank the two men on reception in allowing us to use telephone and internet access when we were trying to get home via rail and coach nothing was too much trouble for them. So if you intend to visit Barcelona you will not go far wrong if you stay at the Hesperia Ramblas. If you want a good tapas go to Taller de Tapas on Pl Sant Josep Oriol - few minutes from hotel

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: pussycatdogs
Reviews.Content: it's an excellent hotel.good location. our room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: gobabu
Reviews.Content: Barcelona is bautiful city I have ever visited. In this beautiful city, this is very good hotel I feel. Please check other reviews as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: ovler
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, friendly staff and the room looked exactly like the photos on the hotel's web-site!!!! This is what a three-star hotel should be. I would rate 3+

Reviews.Title: “Superior Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: Kalel23
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time searching through hotels and after much deliberation, settled on the Hesperia Ramblas, relying on reviews submitted on TripAdvisor. It proved to be a great choice. We stayed for 3 nights in the last week of February paying £78, £74, and £64. Firstly, the location is supreme. We caught the Aerobus directly from the airport (El Prat) which drops you off by the Hard Rock Café. The hotel was just a short 10 minute walk from there. Admittedly we did catch a taxi from drop-off point to hotel just for convenience but in retrospect, was not necessary. The hotel is situated on one of the roads leading off la Ramblas – you could not be better placed. We were a 5 minute walk from the port and virtually on la Ramblas. Catalunya Plaza was a 5 minute walk. The nearest metro station is just 1 minute away! Although close to the action, we were just far enough away to enjoy a peaceful night. The immediate area is quiet but well lit and safe enough. The hotel itself is clean and well presented. Check in was quick and easy. The rooms were just as shown in the pictures and were immaculate. They were spacious, stylishly decorated and cleaned everyday. Bathroom again was large and very clean. As others have mentioned, the shower is very powerful - almost like having a massage (which is the perfect tonic after a long day of sight-seeing). We thought that the bed was comfortable and afforded us a good night’s rest. The hotel staff were brilliant. All spoke clear English, were knowledgeable and extremely receptive to our questions. Offered great directions and suggestions of places to go according to what we were looking for. You have to be buzzed through the main doors, but this was never a problem. We were never kept waiting and most of the time they seemed to almost pre-empt our arrival! They also kept hold of our luggage on the last day with no fuss as were weren’t flying out till the evening. Of course the hotel has no restaurant or bar or any other facilities for that matter, but then, you just don’t need them being so close to la Ramblas. Everything that you need is just a stone’s throw away. Ultimately it is the perfect base from which to explore the beautiful city and to recharge your batteries for the next day of adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, cant wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: CLUK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hesperia Ramblas for two nights; I’m 25 and visited Barcelona with my parents both 54 and sister 24 On arrival we were extremely pleased the hotel it was modern, clean and the reception we were given was very pleasant. The rooms were spotless, sheets were amazing and bathroom had a really powerful shower. Breakfast was 12Euros each which we thought was expensive but as the hotel is in such a fantastic location you aren’t far from cafés. We ate in Café de L’Opera for both mornings. We went to a real Spanish Tapas restaurant called Bar Celta, the restaurant is really basic but the atmosphere was great and the food was delicious. we walked everywhere, but i would recommend both the blue and red bus routes, and Gaudi’s cathedral is incredible I can’t wait to go back to Barcelona with my boyfriend and I will defiantly be staying at the Hesperia Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: DPMCG_9
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a two night stay at Hisperia Ramblas and was very disappointed to say the least. We paid €278 ($400) for the two nights and felt that we would have had the same amenities in a youth hostel. On our arrival the bathroom sink had black hairs in it, there were no covers on the pillows and no english language TV channels. We were informed that the laundry had not returned pillow cases that day and that the wind had blown the satellite dish out of place! All weekend there was only one staff at reception and we were told on Saturday evening that the chambermaid might go onto the roof to try to fix satellite dish, as there were no maintenance staff working during holiday periods!!! Needless to say ... this didn't happen. The rooms are very sparsely furnished and the bathroom toiletries are a joke. There are tea/coffee making facilities at reception but you must pay for these. Overall very bad value for money and a bit of a "Fawlty Towers" experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, spotlessly clean”
Reviews.Author: dwnw3
Reviews.Content: Ansolutely no complaints about this hotel, although not on the nicest of side streets, the hotel is in a perfectly safe location and less than a minutes walk once you turn off La Rambla. The room and bathroom were spacious, well maintained, immaculately clean; it all looked almost new. Front desk staff were friendly & helpful. We did not have breakfast at the hotel but can highly recommend Forn Del Pi coffee shop at Hospital 40, they also have another branch at Ferran 12; very good for breakfast, lunch, a snack or just a pick-me up of a pastry and a hot drink.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in everything”
Reviews.Author: Griegos
Reviews.Content: It is an excellent hotel in a great location next to everything.It is more than a 3 star hotel and the staff is really helpfull, speaking english and they provide you with useful information material.The hotel is clean and the rooms are very cozy and good decorated .We recommend it to everyone !!

Reviews.Title: “Hesperia”
Reviews.Author: VandaT
Reviews.Content: Great! But without breakfast, what it's not a problem indeed because you could find nice places at nice prices for your breakfast, near to the hotel. Is really close to Las Ramblas and in the top of El Raval barrio (safely and calm).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dandd888
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very centrally located. It's modern and fresh decor is very pleasing. Staff were always happy to help and were fluent in what seemed to be endless amounts of languages. The only bad point was the room was very warm and the AC was only for heat for some reason so if you don't mind sleeping with the window open that's fine. Noise wasn't a problem.

Reviews.Title: “great choice”
Reviews.Author: darhines
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 days in Barcelona. This hotel is centrally located just off Las Ramblas, the rooms are small but comfortable. Staff is friendly and helpful.Only drawback is they turned the A/C off to the entire hotel and you could only get heat. It wasn't quite time of the year for NO air, but we made due with opening windows, although the street noise was a distraction. There are plenty of tapas bars and breakfast location on Las Ramblas, so no need for a taxi. I recommend the Bus Turistica, hop on/ hop off open air buses for viewing the city. Get the two day pass discount at the hotel and enjoy the bus. Plenty of sights to see and lots to do. Don't miss Park Guell, it is fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “not possible to go wrong with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: petesh
Reviews.Content: The other reviews say it all. great location, lovely rooms, friendly staff. we are on our way back to Australia following a cruise and booked into this hotel based on reviews and were definitely not dissappointed. to exchange currency if staying in this area change your money at the hotel. they charge 4% if you change it on las ramblas expect to pay 18%.
